headline: Albemarle (ALB) Q2 Earnings: Taking a Look at Key Metrics Versus Estimates
summary: The headline numbers for Albemarle (ALB) give insight into how the company performed in the quarter ended June 2025, but it may be worthwhile to compare some of its key metrics to Wall Street estimates and the year-ago actuals.

headline: Albemarle (ALB) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Top Estimates
summary: Albemarle (ALB) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +113.25% and +6.98%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Albemarle Announces New General Counsel, Corporate Secretary and Chief Compliance Officer
summary: Albemarle Corporation (NYSE: ALB), a global leader in providing essential elements for mobility, energy, connectivity and health, announced today that Ander Krupa has been promoted to executive vice president, general counsel, corporate secretary and chief compliance officer.

raw.headline: Albemarle Announces New General Counsel, Corporate Secretary and Chief Compliance Officer
raw.summary: Albemarle Corporation (NYSE: ALB), a global leader in providing essential elements for mobility, energy, connectivity and health, announced today that Ander Krupa has been promoted to executive vice president, general counsel, corporate secretary and chief compliance officer.

headline: Albemarle: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — Albemarle Corp. ALB) on Wednesday reported second-quarter net income of $22.9 million, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier. On a per-share basis, the Charlotte, North Carolina-based company said it had net loss of 16 cents.

raw.headline: Albemarle: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — Albemarle Corp. ALB) on Wednesday reported second-quarter net income of $22.9 million, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier. On a per-share basis, the Charlotte, North Carolina-based company said it had net loss of 16 cents.

headline: Albemarle posts surprise second-quarter profit on lithium demand; shares surge
summary: (Reuters) -Albemarle, the world's largest producer of lithium for rechargeable batteries, posted a surprise second-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by sustained demand for the metal, sending its shares up over 6% after the bell.  Albemarle said its net sales came in at $1.33 billion during the quarter, 7% lower than last year but still above analysts' expectations of $1.22 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.  To weather the pricing glut, Albemarle has taken measures such as job cuts and cancelling expansion projects - including a key U.S. lithium refinery.

Albemarle said its net sales came in at $1.33 billion during the quarter, 7% lower than last year but still above analysts' expectations of $1.22 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.  To weather the pricing glut, Albemarle has taken measures such as job cuts and cancelling expansion projects - including a key U.S. lithium refinery.

headline: Albemarle: Now It's Really Time To Look At Lithium (Rating Upgrade)
summary: Lithium market recovery looms as supply cuts and demand grow. Albemarle offers contrarian opportunity with strong upside, targeting $130/share in 4-5 years.
